body_html: @soumith, no, cudnn does not do memory oversubscribing, and @csarofeen already tried the same network in lua torch with cudnn, where it gets expected memory usage. Also, he is getting OOMs on slightly bigger networks, where apparently caching allocator should have tried to free previous blocks. Interesting that @apaszke can not repro this.
